intro: Iris pallasii var. chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It features upright, sword-shaped leaves and produces striking blue to violet flowers with three upright petals and three drooping sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils in partial shade. It is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other moist habitats. The species is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
